Ford, Jr.]]'' '''Lester Randolph Ford, Sr.''' (October 25, 1886, [[Missouri]] – November 11, 1967, [[Charlottesville, Virginia]]) was an American mathematician, editor of the ''[[American Mathematical Monthly]]'' from 1942 to 1946, and President of the [[Mathematical Association of America]] from 1947 to 1948.<ref name="mactutor">{{MacTutor Biography|id=Ford}}</ref> [[Ford circle]]s are named after him.<ref name="mactutor"/> He is the father of [[Lester R. Ford, Jr.]]<ref name="mactutor"/> In 1964 the MAA recognised his contribution to mathematics by establishing the Lester R. Ford Awards for authors of articles of expository excellence published in ''[[The American Mathematical Monthly]]'' or ''[[Mathematics Magazine]]''.<ref name="mactutor"/><ref>[http://www.maa.org/Awards/ford.html Lester R. Ford Award]</ref><ref>[http://www.maa.org/history/presidents/ford.html MAA presidents: Lester Randolph Ford Sr.]</ref> His doctoral students include [[Edwin F. Beckenbach|Edwin Beckenbach]]. ==Publications== *{{Citation | last1=Ford | first1=Lester R. | title=Automorphic functions | url=http://books.google.com/books?id=aqPvo173YIIC | publisher=New York, McGraw-Hill | isbn=978-0-8218-3741-2 | jfm=55.0810.04 | year=1929}}<ref>{{cite journal|author=Ritt, J.
